title: Caslon VSuperfine originally from where?
content:
I have this font called Caslon V Superfine but I'd like to find out where it comes from originally and when I google it, there are no hits. I have a client who wants to buy the font but I literally can't find it anywhere on the internet!!! Where does Caslon superfine come from?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [caslon.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419085915/http:/typophile.com/files/caslon.jpg) | 35.42 KB |
author: mjhalo

comments.content: Looks like a [Caslon 540](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419085915/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/caslon+540/fonts/) with a negative stroke to me.

If you open the font in fontlab you might be able to find the details of the author and foundry.  
Is this close?  
 [http://www.linotype.com/396606/SGNewCaslonSBStdRoman-ot-cff-std-font.htm...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419085915/http:/www.linotype.com/396606/SGNewCaslonSBStdRoman-ot-cff-std-font.html?showVariation=395828 "http://www.linotype.com/396606/SGNewCaslonSBStdRoman-ot-cff-std-font.html?showVariation=395828")

Yea but its literally a font family in a package called "CaslonV" There is CaslonVthin CaslonVitalic.... but it is nowhere to be found on the internet...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419085915im_/http:/typophile.com/files/caslonV_5521.jpg)

Hey,

I can answer this, if it hasn't already been solved?

Caslon V was commissioned in 2003 by Fabien Baron, as a headline typeface for Vogue Paris (Hence the "V"). To my knowledge, it's not available to licence or buy.

/T
